sentence.Network_en: Nearly 2,500 have died in separatist violence this year.
sentence.Network_cn: 近2,500人在今年的分裂主义暴乱中丧生。

sentence.Network_en: The country is now racked by three violent separatist movements.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个国家目前正被3场激烈的分离主义运动所困扰。

sentence.Network_en: Separatist movements are a threat to the integrity of the nation.
sentence.Network_cn: 分离主义运动对国家统一是个威胁。

list.exp: 臭名昭著的分裂主义者
list.abs: infamous separatist 臭名昭著的分裂主义者; infamous conduct 行为不正; 行为不端; Infamous Post 企业耻辱柱; Infamous OST 盛名之下.

entry.tran: 分裂主义的;独立主义的
entry.def: Separatist organizations and activities within a country involve members of a group of people who want to establish their own separate government or are trying to do so.

example.ex: Nearly 2,500 have died in separatist violence this year.
example.tran: 近 2,500 人在今年的分裂主义暴乱中丧生。

entry.tran: 分裂主义者;独立主义者
entry.def: Separatists are people who want their own separate government or are involved in separatist activities.

example.ex: The army has come under attack by separatists.
example.tran: 军队一直遭到分裂主义者的袭击。

means.word_mean: 1. an advocate of secession or separation from a larger group (such as an established church or a national union)
1. having separated or advocating separation from another entity or policy or attitude;
